technology.title: The White House Wades Into the Console Wars, Releases AI Image of Donald Trump as Master Chief Saluting in Front of an American Flag That Contains a Big Mistake - IGN
Here’s what ads on your $2,000 Samsung smart fridge will look like - The Verge
technology.description: A new widget coming to the built-in screen will show ‘curated advertisements’ starting next month. But you can opt out.

technology.title: Ed Zitron Gets Paid to Love AI. He Also Gets Paid to Hate AI - WIRED
technology.description: He’s one of the loudest voices of the AI haters—even as he does PR for AI companies. Either way, Ed Zitron has your attention.

technology.title: Battlefield 6 Update 1.1.1.0 Goes Live Tomorrow with Enhancements to Movement, Weapon Dispersion and Visibility - Wccftech
technology.description: Electronic Arts has confirmed that Battlefield 6 update 1.1.1.0 will go live tomorrow just before the debut of Season 1.

technology.title: It's 2025, and Pixels still don't seem to deliver notifications on time - Android Authority
technology.description: Pixel 10 owners are no reporting that notifications on their phones are severely delayed, but this isn't a new problem for Google's phones.

business.title: Jets win 1st game of year, QB breaks Cam Newton record and Aaron Rodgers loses against former team: NFL Week 8 Sunday wrap - CNN
business.description: Despite Week 8 in the 2025 NFL season being dubbed “Bye-mageddon” – six teams were on bye weeks, leaving fantasy football players scrambling – Sunday was jam-packed with action.

business.title: Jerry Jones not happy with Cowboys’ record, will consider trades to make team better - NBC Sports
business.description: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones is not happy that his team is 3-4-1 eight games into the season.

business.title: Aaron Rodgers: Steelers used a silent count at home because Packers fans were so loud - NBC Sports
business.description: "Packers fans travel really well," Rodgers said. "First time in a while I used silent count for a home game. That's a credit to those Packer fans."

business.title: Week 8 NFL Takeaways: How People Are Looking at the Colts the Wrong Way - Sports Illustrated
business.description: Indianapolis had more talent than you realize before Daniel Jones arrived. Plus, Jordan Love talks about his relationship with Aaron Rodgers and much more.

business.title: Aaron Rodgers wasn't seeking 'revenge' against the Packers, who gave him a reality check instead - AP News
business.description: Aaron Rodgers was solid but not spectacular in his first-ever game against the Green Bay Packers. The Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback passed for 219 yards and two touchdowns in a 35-25 loss to the team he won four MVPs and a Super Bowl with earlier in his car…
